Package stocks

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BetterStock
    The BetterStock interface extends the functionality of the Stock interface to allow for the adjusting of stocks on a certain day.
    Stock
    The stock interface represents stock objects that are able to track their own number of shares, historical data and identity (ticker).
    StockData
    The stocks.StockData interface represents different forms of stocks.Stock data and operations for that data.
    StockDataSource
    The stocks.StockDataSource interface represents different types of data sources for reporting stock information and methods to retrieve the data.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AdvancedStock
    the AdvancedStock class represents a stock with additional functionality.
    AdvancedStock.Transaction
    The static inner class Transaction represents a simple stock transaction, keeping track of the number of shares (+ if bought, - if sold), the date of the transaction, and the total value of the transaction (the pricePaid field tracks the entry price that the user paid to buy the stock, it is not currently used for any functionality but could be used later to track cost basis vs total portfolio value).
    AdvancedStockTest
    The StockTest class represent tests for Stock objects and associated methods.
    AlphaVantageDataSource
    The stocks.AlphaVantageDataSource class represents the data source for the AlphaVantage API.
    AlphaVantageDataSourceTest
    The AlphaVantageDataSourceTest class represents tests for methods on AlphaVantageDataSource objects.
    CSVSources
    The stocks.CSVSources class represents all Comma Separated Values input sources including web and local files.
    CSVSourcesTest
    The CSVSourcesTest class represents tests for methods on CSVSources objects.
    DailyStockData
    The stocks.DailyStockData class represents day-to-day stock data in the form of high, low, open, close, and volume values.
    DailyStockDataTest
    The DailyStockDataTest class represents tests for DailyStockData objects and associated methods.
    LocalCSVDataSource
    The LocalCSVDataSource class represents a CSV stock data source from a local file.
    LocalCSVDataSourceTest
    The LocalCSVDataSourceTest class represents tests for methods on LocalCSVDataSource objects.
    SimpleStock
    The stocks.Stock class represents basic information about a stock in a portfolio, including symbol, number of shares, and historical data.
    SimpleStockTest
    The StockTest class represent tests for Stock objects and associated methods.
